5.SceneDescription:
The conference room in Tulsa again, Chandler is trying to evade
Wendy

lines.Line:
Whoa-ho, back off, Missy! (He takes a step back, but she still
keeps her grip on his tie.
(laughs) ...Missy

I don't know; I'm not used to girls making passes at me! ...
(She lets go of his tie) Wait a minute... am I sexy in Oklahoma

You are to me... (She gets closer again, putting her arms around
his waist/chest.

(flattered) No,... no... (realizing) NO! (He quickly gets several
steps away from her.) Look, I'm, I'm married
So? I'm married. (Showing him the ring on her finger.
I'm *happily* married
I'm *happily* married
I'm *happily* married
Oh. What's *that* like
Right. So, I'm sorry..

Seriously? Happily married. So that phone call before, that was

Well look, it's not easy to spend this much time apart, you know.
She's entitled to be a little paranoid... or, in this case:
right on money! ... You know, she's amazing, and beautiful, and
smart, and if she were here right now, ...she'd kick your ass.

6.SceneDescription: A hallway in the hospital, Monica and Chandler are talking.

lines.Line: So, are you really gonna go out with that nurse man

Well uh, you and I are just goofing around, I thought, why not

if you have this new fangled dictionary that gets you made at
me, then we have to, y'know, get you my original dictionary.
I am *so* bad at this
I think you're better than you think you are

7.SceneDescription:
Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is looking at the
wedding book as Monica enters.

lines.Line:
Listen umm, I've been thinking, it's not fair for me to ask
you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you
work, you work really hard for that
Ehh
Ehh
Eh, you work for that

Look, I thought about it too, and I'm sorry. I think we should
spend all of the money on the wedding
You do?
You do?
You do?

Yeah, I'm putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I
told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if
having the perfect wedding makes you happy, then, then that's
what we're gonna do

Oh, you're so sweet. (They hug and kiss.) Oh, but wait, what
about our, what about the future and stuff

Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two
kids, y'know? We'll pick our favorite and that one will get
to go to college
You thought about that
You thought about that
Yeah
Yeah
How many kids were we gonna have
Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy
What else did you think about
What else did you think about

Well, stuff like where we'd live, y'know? Like a small place
outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their
bikes and stuff. Y'know, we could have a cat that had a bell
on its collar and we could hear it every time it ran through
the little kitty door. Of course, we'd have an apartment over
the garage where Joey could grow old
(laughs) Y'know what? I-I don't want a big, fancy wedding
Sure you do
Sure you do
No, I want everything that you just said. I want a marriage
You sure
You sure
Uh-hmm
Uh-hmm
I love you so much
I love you. (They kiss.

8.SceneDescription:
Mondler's Apartment, Monica is cleaning up, Chandler is sitting
on the couch, checking the Job offers in a Newspaper.

lines.Line:
Actuary... no. Book-keeper... no. Topless dancer... (he looks
down on himself, checking, then nods satisfied and marks the
offer with a pen) (to Monica:) Hey, d'you know what I just
realized? You are the sole wage earner. *You* are the head of
the household. I don't do anything - I'm a kept man

You are! (she picks up a bill from the table, handing it to
Chandler) Hey, here's twenty bucks. -- Why don't you go buy
yourself something pretty while I'm at work tomorrow
